1.text: NOW the feast of the pasch, and of the Azymes was after two days; and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might by some wile lay hold on him, and kill him.

2.text: But they said: Not on the festival day, lest there should be a tumult among the people.

3.text: And when he was in Bethania, in the house of Simon the leper, and was at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of precious spikenard: and breaking the alabaster box, she poured it out upon his head.

4.text: Now there were some that had indignation within themselves, and said: Why was this waste of the ointment made?

5.text: For this ointment might have been sold for more than three hundred pence, and given to the poor. And they murmured against her.

6.text: But Jesus said: Let her alone, why do you molest her? She hath wrought a good work upon me.

7.text: For the poor you have always with you: and whensoever you will, you may do them good: but me you have not always.

8.text: She hath done what she could: she is come beforehand to anoint my body for burial.

9.text: Amen, I say to you, wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, that also which she hath done, shall be told for a memorial of her.

10.text: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests, to betray him to them.

11.text: Who hearing it were glad; and they promised him they would give him money. And he sought how he might conveniently betray him.

12.text: Now on the first day of the unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the pasch, the disciples say to him: Whither wilt thou that we go, and prepare for thee to eat the pasch?

13.text: And he sendeth two of his disciples, and saith to them: Go ye into the city; and there shall meet you a man carrying a pitcher of water, follow him;

14.text: And whithersoever he shall go in, say to the master of the house, The master saith, Where is my refectory, where I may eat the pasch with my disciples?

15.text: And he will shew you a large dining room furnished; and there prepare ye for us.

16.text: And his disciples went their way, and came into the city; and they found as he had told them, and they prepared the pasch.

17.text: And when evening was come, he cometh with the twelve.

18.text: And when they were at table and eating, Jesus saith: Amen I say to you, one of you that eateth with me shall betray me.

19.text: But they began to be sorrowful, and to say to him one by one: Is it I?

20.text: Who saith to them: One of the twelve, who dippeth with me his hand in the dish.

21.text: And the Son of man indeed goeth, as it is written of him: but woe to that man by whom the Son of man shall be betrayed. It were better for him, if that man had not been born.

22.text: And whilst they were eating, Jesus took bread; and blessing, broke, and gave to them, and said: Take ye. This is my body.

23.text: And having taken the chalice, giving thanks, he gave it to them. And they all drank of it.

24.text: And he said to them: This is my blood of the new testament, which shall be shed for many.

25.text: Amen I say to you, that I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I shall drink it new in the kingdom of God.

26.text: And when they had said an hymn, they went forth to the mount of Olives.

27.text: And Jesus saith to them: You will all be scandalized in my regard this night; for it is written, I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep shall be dispersed.

28.text: But after I shall be risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.

29.text: But Peter saith to him: Although all shall be scandalized in thee, yet not I.

30.text: And Jesus saith to him: Amen I say to thee, to day, even in this night, before the cock crow twice, thou shall deny me thrice.

31.text: But he spoke the more vehemently: Although I should die together with thee, I will not deny thee. And in like manner also said they all.

32.text: And they came to a farm called Gethsemani. And he saith to his disciples: Sit you here, while I pray.

33.text: And he taketh Peter and James and John with him; and he began to fear and to be heavy.

34.text: And he saith to them: My soul is sorrowful even unto death; stay you here, and watch.

35.text: And when he was gone forward a little, he fell flat on the ground; and he prayed, that if it might be, the hour might pass from him.

36.text: And he saith: Abba, Father, all things are possible to thee: remove this chalice from me; but not what I will, but what thou wilt.

37.text: And he cometh, and findeth them sleeping. And he saith to Peter: Simon, sleepest thou? couldst thou not watch one hour?

38.text: Watch ye, and pray that you enter not into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.

39.text: A going away again, he prayed, saying the same words.

40.text: And when he returned, he found them again asleep, (for their eyes were heavy,) and they knew not what to answer him.

41.text: And he cometh the third time, and saith to them: Sleep ye now, and take your rest. It is enough: the hour is come: behold the Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of sinners.

42.text: Rise up, let us go. Behold, he that will betray me is at hand.

43.text: And while he was yet speaking, cometh Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve: and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the ancients.

44.text: And he that betrayed him, had given them a sign, saying: Whomsoever I shall kiss, that is he; lay hold on him, and lead him away carefully.

45.text: And when he was come, immediately going up to him, he saith: Hail, Rabbi; and he kissed him.

46.text: But they laid hands on him, and held him.

47.text: An one of them that stood by, drawing a sword, struck a servant of the chief priest, and cut off his ear.

48.text: And Jesus answering, said to them: Are you come out as to a robber, with swords and staves to apprehend me?

49.text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you did not lay hands on me. But that the scriptures may be fulfilled.

50.text: Then his disciples leaving him, all fled away.

51.text: And a certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth cast about his naked body; and they laid hold on him.

52.text: But he, casting off the linen cloth, fled from them naked.

53.text: And they brought Jesus to the high priest; and all the priests and the scribes and the ancients assembled together.

54.text: And Peter followed him from afar off, even into the court of the high priest; and he sat with the servants at the fire, and warmed himself.

55.text: And the chief priests and all the council sought for evidence against Jesus, that they might put him to death, and found none.

56.text: For many bore false witness against him, and their evidences were not agreeing.

57.text: And some rising up, bore false witness against him, saying:

58.text: We heard him say, I will destroy this temple made with hands, and within three days I will build another not made with hands.

59.text: And their witness did not agree.

60.text: And the high priest rising up in the midst, asked Jesus, saying: Answerest thou nothing to the things that are laid to thy charge by these men?

61.text: But he held his peace, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, and said to him: Art thou the Christ the Son of the blessed God?

62.text: And Jesus said to him: I am. And you shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of the power of God, and coming with the clouds of heaven.

63.text: Then the high priest rending his garments, saith: What need we any further witnesses?

64.text: You have heard the blasphemy. What think you? Who all condemned him to be guilty of death.

65.text: And some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to buffet him, and to say unto him: Prophesy: and the servants struck him with the palms of their hands.

66.text: Now when Peter was in the court below, there cometh one of the maidservants of the high priest.

67.text: And when she had seen Peter warming himself, looking on him she saith: Thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth.

68.text: But he denied, saying: I neither know nor understand what thou sayest. And he went forth before the court; and the cock crew.

69.text: And again a maidservant seeing him, began to say to the standers by: This is one of them.

70.text: But he denied again. And after a while they that stood by said again to Peter: Surely thou art one of them; for thou art also a Galilean.

71.text: But he began to curse and to swear, saying; I know not this man of whom you speak.

72.text: And immediately the cock crew again. And Peter remembered the word that Jesus had said unto him: Before the cock crow twice, thou shalt thrice deny me. And he began to weep.
